CvContourPolygon * cvb::cvSimplifyPolygon (CvContourPolygon const *p, double const delta=1.)
 Simplify a polygon reducing the number of vertex according the distance "delta". Uses a version of the Ramer-Douglas-Peucker algorithm (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ramer-Douglas-Peucker_algorithm).
CvContourPolygon * cvb::cvPolygonContourConvexHull (CvContourPolygon const *p)
 Calculates convex hull of a contour. Uses the Melkman Algorithm. Code based on the version in http://w3.impa.br/~rdcastan/Cgeometry/.
void cvb::cvWriteContourPolygonCSV (const CvContourPolygon &p, const std::string &filename)

 Write a contour to a SVG file (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scalable_Vector_Graphics).
unsigned int cvb::cvLabel (IplImage const *img, IplImage *imgOut, CvBlobs &blobs)
 Label the connected parts of a binary image. Algorithm based on paper "A linear-time component-labeling algorithm using contour tracing technique" of Fu Chang, Chun-Jen Chen and Chi-Jen Lu.
void cvb::cvFilterLabels (IplImage *imgIn, IplImage *imgOut, const CvBlobs &blobs)

void cvb::cvFilterByArea (CvBlobs &blobs, unsigned int minArea, unsigned int maxArea)
 Filter blobs by area. Those blobs whose areas are not in range will be erased from the input list of blobs.

double cvb::cvAngle (CvBlob *blob)
 Calculates angle orientation of a blob.
void cvb::cvSaveImageBlob (const char *filename, IplImage *img, CvBlob const *blob)
 Save the image of a blob to a file. The function uses an image (that can be the original pre-processed image or a processed one, or even the result of cvRenderBlobs, for example) and a blob structure. Then the function saves a copy of the part of the image where the blob is.

void cvb::cvUpdateTracks (CvBlobs const &b, CvTracks &t, const double thDistance, const unsigned int thInactive, const unsigned int thActive=0)
 Updates list of tracks based on current blobs. Tracking based on: A. Senior, A. Hampapur, Y-L Tian, L. Brown, S. Pankanti, R. Bolle. Appearance Models for Occlusion Handling. Second International workshop on Performance Evaluation of Tracking and Surveillance Systems & CVPR'01. December, 2001. (http://www.research.ibm.com/peoplevision/PETS2001.pdf)
